1.speaker: penguin
1.japanese: 最近あったかくなってきたね

3.speaker: panda
3.japanese: おかげで朝起きられなくて困っちゃうよ
3.english: And because of that, I can't get up in the morning and it's really annoying.

4.speaker: penguin
4.japanese: キミ 年中 寝てるじゃない
4.english: You sleep all year. You know that, right? Heave-ho, heave-ho, heave-ho... Heave-ho.

5.speaker: panda
5.japanese: あれ 何やってるんだろう

9.speaker: penguin
9.japanese: 何始めてるんだろうね
9.english: I wonder what's about to start?

11.speaker: panda
11.japanese: テレビで見たことあるよ
11.english: I've seen this on TV before.

14.speaker: penguin
14.japanese: パンダさん サインください
14.english: Mr. Panda, could I get your autograph?!

15.speaker: penguin
15.japanese: パンダさん 握手してください
15.english: Mr. Panda, could I shake your hand?! Mr. Panda! Mr. Panda! Autograph! Autograph! So cool! Hand shake! Hand shake! Mr. Panda! So cooly cute!

16.speaker: penguin
16.japanese: 間違った妄想に僕を出演させるのやめてくれるかな
16.english: Could you not feature me in your incorrect delusions?

19.speaker: penguin
19.japanese: ああ ひなまつりだよ
19.english: Oh, it's the Doll Festival. What?

21.speaker: polar bear
21.japanese: よいしょ よいしょ

22.speaker: penguin
22.english: That would be a summer festival {\i1}(natsu matsuri){\i0}.

23.speaker: penguin
23.japanese: それは まつり縫い
23.english: That would be blind stitching {\i1}(matsuri nui){\i0}.

25.speaker: penguin
25.english: That would be fishing{\i1}(tsuri){\i0}. The Doll Fes-ti-val!

26.speaker: penguin
26.japanese: お人形さんを飾ったりしてお祝いする
26.english: The festival for girls where they put up dolls as decorations. Oh, I know that one. The bamboo leaf cakes are delicious.

27.speaker: sasako
27.japanese: それはこどもの日じゃないかな
27.english: I think you eat those on Children's Day, actually.

28.speaker: penguin
28.japanese: パンダ君 妹がいるでしょ
28.english: You have a younger sister, don't you?

29.english: You don't remember the festival? Oh, it's the day that you eat the hard and soft ones.

30.speaker: penguin
30.japanese: キミは 食べ物にしか記憶力が働かないのかな
30.english: Are you only able to remember food, by chance? Heave-ho, heave-ho...

31.speaker: panda
31.japanese: ねぇねぇ こう並べればいいんだよ
31.english: Hey. You should set them up like this.

34.speaker: polar bear
34.japanese: こんなこともあろうかと思って
34.english: I thought this might happen, so...

35.speaker: penguin
35.japanese: 思い出したくない思い出を飾らないで
35.english: Please don't use memories I want to forget as decorations...

36.speaker: penguin
36.japanese: というか ひなまつりだよ
36.english: And this is the Doll Festival!

37.speaker: penguin
37.japanese: 古風な伝統あるお祭りなんだから
37.english: It's a festival full of ancient tradition!

38.speaker: sasako
38.japanese: じゃあ 私も並べるの手伝いますね
38.english: Then I'll help put up the decorations, too.

40.speaker: polar bear
40.japanese: 古風すぎる ひなまつりだね
40.english: That might be a bit too ancient...

41.speaker: penguin
41.japanese: 笹子さん家って 土偶並べるの
41.english: Do you display clay dolls at your house, Miss Sasako?

44.speaker: penguin
44.japanese: 嫌な予感しかしないね
44.english: I have nothing but bad feelings about this.

46.speaker: polar bear
46.english: The three ladies in waiting {\i1}(sannin kanjo){\i0}.

47.speaker: penguin
47.japanese: サツマイモは甘藷でしょ

50.speaker: penguin
50.japanese: もしかして 五人囃子のつもり？
50.english: Are they supposed to be the five court musicians {\i1}(go-nin bayashi){\i0}?

51.speaker: polar bear
51.english: Correct! Uh, that's pushing it quite a bit.

54.speaker: polar bear
54.japanese: ペンギンさん 邪魔だって
54.english: They said you're in the way, Mr. Penguin.

55.speaker: penguin
55.japanese: 邪魔してたのはそっちでしょ
55.english: {\i1}You{\i0} are the one who was getting in their way!

56.speaker: penguin
56.japanese: こんなんじゃ いつまで経っても完成しそうにないね
56.english: At this rate, they're never going to finish decorating.

57.speaker: polar bear
57.japanese: しかたないから 真面目にやろう
57.english: I guess there's no choice but to do this seriously.

58.speaker: grizzly
58.japanese: おい シロクマ 今 俺を起こそうとしただろ
58.english: Hey, Polar Bear! You're trying to wake me up, aren't you?!

61.speaker: grizzly
61.japanese: いつも俺の睡眠の邪魔しやがって
61.english: You're always getting in the way of my sleep.

62.speaker: grizzly
62.japanese: だんだんお前から電話がかかってくるタイミングが
62.english: Now I'm getting to know the timing that you'll call me, damn it.

63.speaker: polar bear
63.japanese: もう引きこもりはやめたの
63.english: Have you given up being a shut-in {\i1}(hikikomori){\i0}?

64.speaker: grizzly
64.english: I'm holed up for the winter {\i1}(fuyugomori){\i0}!

65.speaker: grizzly
65.japanese: ったく 毎度毎度人が寝てる最中に起こしやがって
65.english: Damn it, waking me up whenever you get a chance. How many times do you think you woke me up this winter?

66.speaker: grizzly
66.japanese: おかげで もう目がさえて眠れねえよ
66.english: Now thanks to you, I'm completely awake.

69.speaker: polar bear
69.japanese: 違うよ ほら あれ

70.speaker: grizzly
70.english: The Doll Festival, huh? What the...

71.japanese: って なんで 土偶やらイモやらが並んでんだよ
71.english: Why are there clay dolls and potatoes on there?!

72.speaker: polar bear
72.japanese: グリズリー君 ちょっと手伝ってよ
72.english: Could you help them out a bit, Grizzly?

73.speaker: grizzly
73.english: Jeez... Hey, let me have that.

75.speaker: grizzly
75.english: No, I'm not gonna eat it!

76.speaker: grizzly
76.japanese: ほら ここに置くんだよ

80.speaker: grizzly
80.japanese: 変なもん渡すんじゃねえ
80.english: Don't hand me weird things! Heave-ho, heave-ho...

81.speaker: grizzly
81.japanese: と しようがねえな

82.speaker: grizzly
82.japanese: いいか ここに差すんだよ

86.speaker: grizzly
86.japanese: よし パーフェクトだぜ

87.speaker: baby emp1
87.japanese: うわぁ できた できた

92.speaker: polar bear
92.japanese: でも うちの玄関ふさいでいるね
92.english: But it's blocking the entrance. Wha?

93.speaker: panda
93.japanese: パーフェクトに邪魔だね

94.speaker: polar bear
94.japanese: グリズリー君って いつも
94.english: You always do go a bit too far, Grizzly.

95.speaker: grizzly
95.japanese: お前が やれって言ったんじゃねえか
95.english: {\i1}You{\i0} are the one that told me to do it!

96.speaker: grizzly
96.japanese: ところで これ 誰を祝うんだ
96.english: By the way, who's celebrating this?

98.speaker: grizzly
98.japanese: ひなまつりだから女の子のお祝いだろ
98.english: The Doll Festival, is a day to celebrate girls.

99.speaker: grizzly
99.japanese: お前たちの中で 女の子は
99.english: Who are the girls here? Oh... And who are the boys?

102.speaker: grizzly
102.english: So all of you are guys?!

103.speaker: grizzly
103.japanese: ったく なんで ひなまつりなんかやってんだよ
103.english: Damn it, why the hell are you celebrating the Doll Festival {\i1}(Hina Matsuri){\i0}?!

105.speaker: panda
105.japanese: みんな ヒナなんだし
105.english: I mean, they're all baby chicks {\i1}(hina){\i0}.

107.japanese: ヒナだから ひなまつりだしな
107.english: The Doll Festival {\i1}(Hina Matsuri){\i0} is for themsince they're baby chicks {\i1}(hina){\i0}.

108.speaker: grizzly
108.japanese: って うまいこと言ってんじゃねえ

110.speaker: polar bear
110.japanese: 冬眠明けで ノリがいいね
110.english: He's in a better moodafter his hibernation.

111.speaker: grizzly
111.japanese: 誰か 女の子はいねえのか
111.english: Are there any girls here? Anybody?

113.speaker: sasako
113.english: Huh? Who, me? U-Um... You got a problem with this? No...

114.speaker: sasako
114.japanese: でも ほら 女の子のお祭りですし
114.english: But it's a festival for girls...

115.speaker: penguin
115.japanese: 笹子さん 何気に難しい話題をふるのはやめよう
115.english: Let's not complicate things further, Miss Sasako.

116.speaker: polar bear
116.japanese: 大丈夫 最近はいくつになっても女子力っていうしね
116.english: Don't worry. Lately they talk about girl power, no matter how old you are.

117.speaker: penguin
117.japanese: シロクマ君も 微妙にツッコミづらいネタ出してくるね
117.english: You're somehow making this even more difficult, Polar Bear. Hey, you're not going to wear a kimono, Miss Sasako?

118.speaker: sasako
118.japanese: えっ そんなの持ってきてないよ
118.english: What? I didn't bring anything like that.

121.speaker: grizzly
121.japanese: 誰も お前の着物なんか求めてねえ
121.english: No one asked you to put on a kimono!

122.speaker: panda
122.japanese: わぁ 笹子さん かわいい
122.english: Wow, you look so cute, Miss Sasako!

125.speaker: panda
125.japanese: ねえねえ 笹子さん 質問いい
125.english: Hey, could I ask you a question, Miss Sasako?

126.speaker: sasako
126.english: What is it, Panda? Are you married, Miss Sasako? Huh?!

127.speaker: polar bear
127.english: Well, you see, Panda... Before she started working here...

129.speaker: panda
129.japanese: 結婚してないんだ 相手がいないの
129.english: So you're not married. You can't find anyone?

131.speaker: panda
131.japanese: じゃ 笹子さん 半田さんって どう思う
131.english: Then what do you think about Mr. Handa, Miss Sasako?

135.speaker: sasako
135.japanese: いつも コーヒーばかり飲んでますよね
135.english: He's always drinking coffee, isn't he?

136.speaker: polar bear
136.japanese: 確かに そういえばそうだね

137.speaker: sasako
137.japanese: ここのコーヒー おいしいですから
137.english: Well, the coffee here is delicious.

138.speaker: panda
138.japanese: きっと動物園の給料が安いんだよ
138.english: It must be because he doesn't get paid much at the zoo.

139.speaker: penguin
139.japanese: パンダ君 そういう問題じゃないから
139.english: I don't think that's the issue here, Panda.

140.speaker: panda
140.japanese: いつも思ってたんだよ 休みも少ないしね
140.english: I've always wondered about that. And he doesn't get that much time off, either.

141.speaker: penguin
141.japanese: キミ 年中 休んでるじゃない
141.english: But you take most of the year off.

147.speaker: handa
147.japanese: 笹 笹子さん… かわいい

149.speaker: grizzly
149.japanese: おっと 今日はいいから座ってな
149.english: Hold it. Don't worry about it today. Just sit.

151.speaker: grizzly
151.english: It's the Doll Festival. I'll give you a hand.

152.speaker: polar bear
152.japanese: グリズリー君 これ運んで
152.english: Could you take this out, Grizzly?

153.speaker: grizzly
153.english: Not wasting any time, are you?! Wow! It's the Doll Festival, so I tried making it.

156.speaker: panda
156.japanese: おいしそう 食べていい
156.english: It looks delicious! Can I eat it?

157.speaker: grizzly
157.japanese: ちょっと待ちな ほら
157.english: Hold it right there. Come on.

158.speaker: sasako
158.japanese: あっ はい それでは皆さん

159.speaker: sasako
159.japanese: ひなまつりおめでとうございます

160.speaker: all
160.japanese: ひなまつりおめでとうございます

164.speaker: handa
164.japanese: あの 笹子さん さっきの話ですけど…

167.speaker: handa
167.japanese: 着物 似合ってます
167.english: Y-You look very nice in a kimono.

168.speaker: sasako
168.japanese: ありがとうございます
168.english: Thank you very much. It's delicious.

169.speaker: nurse
169.japanese: シロクマさん どうぞ
169.english: Mr. Polar Bear, please come this way.

172.speaker: doc
172.japanese: 今日は どうなさいました

174.speaker: polar bear
174.japanese: 朝から 熱がありまして
174.english: I've had a fever... since this morning.

175.speaker: doc
175.japanese: 患者さん 大きいですね

177.speaker: doc
177.japanese: 聴診器あてますので上着脱いでください
177.english: I'm going to use the stethoscope, so please remove your coat.

180.speaker: doc
180.japanese: ええと 届かないんで登っていいですか
180.english: Um... I can't reach, so may I climb up?

181.speaker: polar bear
181.english: You're going to climb on me?

182.speaker: doc
182.japanese: 登るのは得意なんですよ

184.speaker: doc
184.japanese: いえ 木登りが得意なんです
184.english: No... I'm good at climbing trees.

188.japanese: お薬出しますので 安静にして寝てください
188.english: I'll give you some medicine, so please stay in bed and get some rest.

190.speaker: lady
190.japanese: すみません 注文いいですか

194.speaker: panda
194.japanese: お見舞いに来たんだよ

197.speaker: penguin
197.english: That would be an arranged meeting {\i1}(omiai){\i0}.

198.speaker: penguin
198.english: Let's hold off on the puns while you're sick, Polar Bear?

199.speaker: polar bear
199.english: Yeah, I'll do that. You've got quite a fever.

200.speaker: polar bear
200.japanese: 薬は飲んだから そのうち下がると思うけど
200.english: I took some medicine, so I think it'll be going down soon.

201.speaker: panda
201.japanese: シロクマ君 何かしてほしいことある
201.english: Is there anything you want us to do, Polar Bear?

202.speaker: polar bear
202.japanese: ううん 別にないけど
202.english: Nope, I can't think of anything.

204.speaker: penguin
204.english: You're sweating quite a bit. Then we'll wipe it off for you.

205.speaker: polar bear
205.japanese: どうして 僕が熱出してるってわかったの
205.english: How'd you know I was out with a fever?

206.speaker: panda
206.japanese: 笹子さんに聞いたんだよ

208.speaker: polar bear
208.japanese: ありがとう 気持よくなったよ

209.speaker: penguin
209.japanese: シロクマ君 朝から何も食べてないんじゃない
209.english: You haven't eaten anything since this morning, have you, Polar Bear?

210.speaker: polar bear
210.japanese: じゃあ 何か食べるもの作るね

211.speaker: penguin
211.japanese: じゃあ 何か食べるもの作るね
211.english: Then we'll make you something to eat.

212.speaker: panda
212.english: I didn't know you could actually do anything other than drink café mocha, Mr. Penguin.

213.speaker: penguin
213.japanese: パンダ君も ゴロゴロする以外のことを覚えたほうがいいよ
213.english: And I think you should learn something other than how to laze around. But I'm cute, so that's all I need.

214.speaker: penguin
214.english: I see. Let's see... Where were the pots?

215.speaker: panda
215.japanese: あぁ これじゃない
215.english: Oh, I think this is it. Almost...

219.speaker: lady
219.japanese: コーヒーおかわりお願いします
219.english: Could I get another coffee? Yes, ma'am.

220.speaker: panda
220.japanese: あぁ ビックリした

221.speaker: panda
221.japanese: 鍋が降ってくるなんて

222.speaker: penguin
222.japanese: 僕は もっとビックリしたよ
222.english: It startled me even more. Panda... Get off of me. You're heavy. There aren't enough ingredients to make anything.

223.speaker: panda
223.english: What were you thinking about making?

224.speaker: penguin
224.japanese: ４８時間 コトコト煮込んだ
224.english: A Sicilian seafood curry with plenty of bouillabaisse that's been simmering for 48 hours.

225.speaker: penguin
225.japanese: 昨日 料理番組で見ておいしそうだったんだ
225.english: I saw it on a cooking show yesterday and it looked really good.

226.speaker: panda
226.japanese: それ できる前に風邪が治っちゃいそうだね
226.english: I think he might recover before that finishes.

227.speaker: penguin
227.japanese: まぁ どっちにしろ材料がないから作れないけどね
227.english: Well, I can't make it anyway since there aren't enough ingredients.

228.speaker: panda
228.japanese: 他の料理は作れないの

229.speaker: panda
229.english: Hey, can't you make anything else?

233.speaker: panda
233.japanese: 作り方がわからないの
233.english: You don't know how to make something?

234.speaker: Penguin
234.japanese: 違うよ 何を作るか考える参考にしようと思って
234.english: I do. I was just looking through to see if I could get any ideas of what to make.

235.speaker: panda
235.japanese: あっ この本どうかな

236.speaker: panda
236.japanese: わぁ ペンギンさん これ見て これ
236.english: Wow, look at this, Mr. Penguin!

239.speaker: panda
239.english: Look! They're pictures of Polar Bear and Mr. Grizzly when they were little.

240.speaker: penguin
240.japanese: あの２人にもかわいい時代があったんだね
240.english: So I guess even those guys were cute at one point.

241.speaker: panda
241.japanese: かわいいの仲間で僕の写真も貼っておくよ
241.english: I'll put in one of my pictures to fit in with the cuteness.

242.speaker: penguin
242.japanese: パンダ君 人の大事な思い出を混乱させるのは やめよう
242.english: Let's not confuse people's precious memories, Panda.

244.speaker: penguin
244.japanese: あれ それ 僕も一緒じゃなかった

245.speaker: panda
245.japanese: えっと… ほらいるよ
245.english: Let's see... See? You're right here. I'm cut in half!

247.speaker: panda
247.japanese: ペンギンさんって生粋のエキストラなんだね
247.english: You're a natural-born extra, Mr. Penguin.

248.speaker: penguin
248.japanese: 主役のときだってあるよ
248.english: I'm the star at times, too!

250.japanese: これを シロクマ君に見せたら喜ぶよ
250.english: If we show these to Polar Bear, it'll make him happy.

251.speaker: penguin
251.japanese: 喜ばないんじゃないかな

257.speaker: penguin
257.japanese: キミ 自由すぎるんじゃない
257.english: You're too much of a free spirit, no?

258.speaker: panda
258.japanese: シロクマ君 まだ熱あるね
258.english: Polar Bear still has a fever.

259.speaker: grizzly
259.japanese: よう じゃまするぜ

260.speaker: grizzly
260.japanese: 熱があるって聞いたんで 見舞いがてら
260.english: I heard you had a fever, so I came by to make yo—

261.speaker: grizzly
261.japanese: 何やってんだ お前ら
261.english: The hell are you two doing?

262.speaker: panda
262.japanese: ああ いらっしゃい

265.speaker: grizzly
265.japanese: おいおい 熱があるじゃねえか

268.speaker: grizzly
268.english: Hurry up... And get to bed!

269.speaker: grizzly
269.japanese: そこで じっとしてろ

271.speaker: sasako
271.japanese: グリズリーさん お店終わったんですけど
271.english: Mr. Grizzly, I've closed up the café.

272.japanese: 何かお手伝いすることはありますか
272.english: Is there anything I can help you with?

273.speaker: grizzly
273.japanese: おう じゃあ リンゴの皮むき頼んだぜ
273.english: All right. I'll have you peel some apples for me then.

275.speaker: polar bear
275.japanese: いいにおいだね さすが グリズリー君
275.english: It smells really good. Nothing less from Grizzly. Hey, sorry, Polar Bear...

276.speaker: penguin
276.japanese: お見舞いに来たのに迷惑かけただけになっちゃって
276.english: We came by to visit you, but ended up causing you trouble instead. It's all right. Don't worry about it.

279.speaker: panda
279.japanese: ぺンギンさん ぺンギンさん

281.speaker: panda
281.japanese: 僕をビルゲーツに紹介してくれないかな
281.english: Could you introduce me to Bill Gates?

282.speaker: penguin
282.japanese: 僕のアドラスには入ってないなあ
282.english: Can't say I have him in my address book.

283.speaker: panda
283.japanese: 僕が笹を食べると課金されていくシステムを作ってくれないかなあ
283.english: I'd like him to create a program where I get paid every time I eat bamboo grass.

284.speaker: penguin
284.japanese: どういうシステムがまるで見えないなあ
284.english: I can't say I have any idea what you're talking about.

285.speaker: sasako
285.japanese: 頑張ってください ぺんぎんさん
285.english: Please do your best, Mr. Penguin!

286.speaker: penguin
286.japanese: 頑張る必要ないことでは頑張りたくないな
286.english: I'd rather not try my best if I don't have to.

287.speaker: penguin
287.japanese: シロクマ君 終わろう

288.speaker: polar bear
288.japanese: 来週のシロクマカフェは
288.english: Next Week's Polar Bear's Café will be presented sneakily, so no one finds out.
